Name: Scarab
Description: Small-sized faience scarab, which has lost almost all of its glazing. It has a small longitudinal hole for suspension which is circular in cross-section. On the bezel is a decoration, composed of various hieroglyphic signs: at the top is the nebu-sign (sign of gold) above a djed-pillar flanked by two nefer-signs (sign of beauty), on either side of which an ankh (sign of life) appears.
